posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi yecori1001!
I think your adjusted build looks very powerful. HP 400 in a build with 26 bard levels (d6 hit die!) is decent, along with AB 43, it is effective 50 AB with bard/curse song 16+ (+2AB/-5AC to enemies) and 56 AB if you taunt them as well. However it is very nice to not have to even rely on these to hit things well. 

I dont think you need improved expertise with +4 AC from RDD 10 and +8 AC from Tumble plus tower shield, but expertise might be nice. I dont think you will have trouble hitting things with taunt and curse song, so the expertise for extra AC might be good against mobs in some environments. 

Your curse song should lower the discipline score of enemies, so knockdown attempts should be easier, plus one has all the AB boosts. I think it would be ok to have plain knockdown in a medium sized character, it is just my preferences I guess. 

Another way to deal with mages is to use the Bard's silence spell. Cast it on yourself, you will be surrounded by a silence aura, if it catches a mage before they can get a dispel off, then the mage might be in trouble (This is Grizzled_Dwarflord's idea in his Vicar of the Void build, with thanks to GDL) the build also has haste and invisibility, so your bard could be charging at the mage invisible and hasted with a silence aura.

Just some thoughts. At the moment I can't see anything I would change anything significantly, Int 16(18) is a reasonable idea for a bard, they tend to have so many great class skills which eat up the skill points. UMD can be 30 modified or 35 or 40 depending on magical items, bards can use scrolls without a check, with the hardcore UMD setting, provided they exceed the item value.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Just keep in mind that your build does not have Uncanny Dodge, so it is vulnerable to flatfootedness (which will result in lots of AC loss)
A flat-footed character loses his dexterity, dodge, and tumble bonuses (but not the penalty for a negative dexterity modifier) to armor class (AC) and cannot make attacks of opportunity, cannot make a defensive roll, and cannot deflect arrows. Furthermore, flat-footed characters are candidates for a sneak attack or death attack.
So having Expertise (or even better, Improved Expertise) can be a great help when Taunting a foe (to cover the loss of AC due to flat-footed)
A taunting character is flat-footed. This condition lasts for a bit less than a round, so it is possible to taunt a low-level opponent (one with at most one attack per round) without receiving an attack while flat-footed.
To get around this, the now-famous Expertise/Imp. Expertise - Taunt combo was created.  I also tend to use the Expertise/Impr. Expertise - Healing Potion as well (because drinking a potion in combat gives AoO).

Great question
Here are my suggestions:
1. Prot v alignment (mind immunity), Amplify, Identify, Mage Armor, Grease

3. Haste (+4AC, 1 extra attack or spell/round, extra speed), Wounding Whispers, Keen Edge, Find Traps, Magic Circle (mind immunity again)

posts.author: Orion

Ghostly visage is a good choice lower levels.
Clarity is handy for mind immunity against neutral alignments later. Invisibility is good to save on level 4 spells. The concealment from II persists but to hide from sight again recasting the invis is nice with a lvl2 spell, unless there are potions etc

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hi yecori!
I have not had time to respond until now.
The build is strong and powerful enough to afford luxuries. I think your high starting intelligence is indeed that, a luxury. If you want it, you can have it. But there are other things you can do with those buy points that makes the build more powerful.
Starting with intelligence 16 instead of 14 only adds one skill to the build. You take no feats that require or benefit from intelligence. Concentration, Spellcraft and Taunt are "nice to have" skills, but not necessarily essential to the build. In most cases one, and sometimes even two of them can be tossed out, depending on your play style and the environment. That being said - I love the Bard skill set and think Bard should have more skill points per level.
If I had those 4 buy points to spend at character creation, I would probably rather spend them on raising charisma to 16 to let it end at 18 for a better Divine Might, better saves and an extra lvl 4 spell slot.
Another tweak I think of is starting with strength 16, swapping Improved critical with Great strength and end up with strength 38 and +1 AB and damage.
You can do both if you are willing to start with intelligence 12, ending at 14. But then you have to say goodbye to your intelligent warrior and two full skills.

With ultra high strength, it isn't just the AB but also damage, for a two handed weapon.
I like to finish strength two handed builds  at even modifiers ie 30 34 38 42 but it's not an essential.
Below 30 I try to go single handed, I believe this is an idea I adopted from Valerfor posted many years ago
Single handed I wouldn't bother going ultra high however and 36 is more than what is required for PvM.
Dev crit is the other factor for ultra high str. With dev crit I would definitely play at least one dev crit build and see how you feel. I played a few of them but have stopped playing such builds, I think because i want to see the big numbers but i dont get to see them if they get terminated prematurely.
In my opinion however damage doesn't matter as much in a high magic environment. 
But in lower magic environments the strength damage is valuable.

Thanks for the help you guys, I have learned a lot from you input.
I have also noticed an error in my last post math, I checked the wrong graph, but the difference is still not a big one.
I have prepared 3 little different builds that I think are more or less optimized for what they are, it is just a matter to choose which one to follow. I think all of them will be fun when playing with them. Build3 drops curse song as an epic extra feat, I think this one might be least fun because of that, even if he keeps his 36 STR, seems like just maxing STR at the cost of fun with the curse song for the duration of whole game.
I pasted them below for anyone interested.

It was fun to think about it and check things, I hope I was not too annoying for you!
